body:
I guess this was a non-tested bug in 0.12, but no longer the case in master/0.13
(fyi the `df.isnull()` is a new way of doing `pd.isnull(df)` in 0.13)

In [17]: pd.**version**
Out[17]: '0.12.0-1097-g6a54af8'

```
In [1]: df = pd.DataFrame(randn(3,2), index=pd.to_datetime(['2001-04-03', '2001-04-04', '2001-04-05']))

In [2]: df
Out[2]: 
                   0         1
2001-04-03 -0.481412 -0.609707
2001-04-04 -0.207233 -1.623831
2001-04-05 -1.389150 -0.154504

In [3]: df.index
Out[3]: 
<class 'pandas.tseries.index.DatetimeIndex'>
[2001-04-03 00:00:00, ..., 2001-04-05 00:00:00]
Length: 3, Freq: None, Timezone: None

In [4]: df.isnull()
Out[4]: 
                0      1
2001-04-03  False  False
2001-04-04  False  False
2001-04-05  False  False

In [5]: df.index
Out[5]: 
<class 'pandas.tseries.index.DatetimeIndex'>
[2001-04-03 00:00:00, ..., 2001-04-05 00:00:00]
Length: 3, Freq: None, Timezone: None

In [6]: df.isnull().index
Out[6]: 
<class 'pandas.tseries.index.DatetimeIndex'>
[2001-04-03 00:00:00, ..., 2001-04-05 00:00:00]
Length: 3, Freq: None, Timezone: None

In [7]: pd.isnull(df)
Out[7]: 
                0      1
2001-04-03  False  False
2001-04-04  False  False
2001-04-05  False  False

In [8]: pd.isnull(df).index
Out[8]: 
<class 'pandas.tseries.index.DatetimeIndex'>
[2001-04-03 00:00:00, ..., 2001-04-05 00:00:00]
Length: 3, Freq: None, Timezone: None

In [9]: df2 = pd.DataFrame(randn(5,3), index=pd.to_datetime(['2001-04-'+x for x in ['03', '04', '05', '06', '09']]))

In [10]: pd.isnull(df2)
Out[10]: 
                0      1      2
2001-04-03  False  False  False
2001-04-04  False  False  False
2001-04-05  False  False  False
2001-04-06  False  False  False
2001-04-09  False  False  False

In [11]: df2.index
Out[11]: 
<class 'pandas.tseries.index.DatetimeIndex'>
[2001-04-03 00:00:00, ..., 2001-04-09 00:00:00]
Length: 5, Freq: None, Timezone: None

In [12]: df3 = pd.DataFrame(randn(9,3), index=pd.to_datetime(['2001-04-'+x for x in ['03', '04', '05', '06', '09', '10', '11', '12', '15']]))

In [13]: df.index
Out[13]: 
<class 'pandas.tseries.index.DatetimeIndex'>
[2001-04-03 00:00:00, ..., 2001-04-05 00:00:00]
Length: 3, Freq: None, Timezone: None

In [14]: pd.isnull(df3)
Out[14]: 
                0      1      2
2001-04-03  False  False  False
2001-04-04  False  False  False
2001-04-05  False  False  False
2001-04-06  False  False  False
2001-04-09  False  False  False
2001-04-10  False  False  False
2001-04-11  False  False  False
2001-04-12  False  False  False
2001-04-15  False  False  False

In [15]: pd.isnull(df3).index
Out[15]: 
<class 'pandas.tseries.index.DatetimeIndex'>
[2001-04-03 00:00:00, ..., 2001-04-15 00:00:00]
Length: 9, Freq: None, Timezone: None

In [16]: df3.index
Out[16]: 
<class 'pandas.tseries.index.DatetimeIndex'>
[2001-04-03 00:00:00, ..., 2001-04-15 00:00:00]
Length: 9, Freq: None, Timezone: None

```

Just to make sure: is the inference of the index frequency used elsewhere?
It is maybe worth checking if there is a problem with the index of df3.

One additional hint: if you replace 15 by 14 (saturday instead of sunday) the conversion is to days instead of business days.
inference is done on demand as needed. this is not present in master, so closing as not-a-bug/fixed.
